column8: Extremamente belo ou impressionante.
column14: Extremely beautiful or impressive.
column15: The views from our hotel room were breathtaking .
column52: Curso::1C1::April Curso::1C1::File_8 Curso::1C1::Vocabulary-Bank::Travel-and-Tourism English English::2VOC Portugues::1VOC Voc::Travel Voc::Travel::English

column8: Não interessante ou excitante; aborrecido.
column14: Not interesting or exciting; boring.
column15: The museum is pretty dull , but the café is good.
column52: Curso::1C1::April Curso::1C1::File_8 Curso::1C1::Vocabulary-Bank::Travel-and-Tourism English English::2VOC Portugues::1VOC Voc::Travel Voc::Travel::English

column8: Muito famoso e representativo de um lugar ou coisa.
column14: Very famous and representative of a place or thing.
column15: The Leaning Tower of Pisa is one of Italy's most iconic sights.
column52: Curso::1C1::April Curso::1C1::File_8 Curso::1C1::Vocabulary-Bank::Travel-and-Tourism English English::2VOC Portugues::1VOC Voc::Travel Voc::Travel::English

column8: Grande e impressionante na aparência.
column14: Grand and impressive in appearance.
column15: The enormous statue at the entrance to the palace is very imposing.
column52: Curso::1C1::April Curso::1C1::File_8 Curso::1C1::Vocabulary-Bank::Travel-and-Tourism English English::2VOC Portugues::1VOC Voc::Travel Voc::Travel::English

column8: Que causa forte impacto devido à beleza, habilidade ou tamanho.
column14: Making a strong impact due to beauty, skill, or size.
column15: The view is really impressive – you should go and have a look.
column52: Curso::1C1::April Curso::1C1::File_8 Curso::1C1::Vocabulary-Bank::Travel-and-Tourism English English::2VOC Portugues::1VOC Voc::Travel Voc::Travel::English

column8: Lento e relaxado, sem pressa.
column14: Slow and relaxed, without hurry.
column15: We took a leisurely stroll along the beach.
column52: Curso::1C1::April Curso::1C1::File_8 Curso::1C1::Vocabulary-Bank::Travel-and-Tourism English English::2VOC Portugues::1VOC Voc::Travel Voc::Travel::English

column8: Cheio de energia, atividade e entusiasmo.
column14: Full of energy, activity, and excitement.
column15: It’s a really lively area at night.
column52: Curso::1C1::April Curso::1C1::File_8 Curso::1C1::Vocabulary-Bank::Travel-and-Tourism English English::2VOC Portugues::1VOC Voc::Travel Voc::Travel::English

column8: Excessivamente cheio de pessoas ou coisas.
column14: Too full of people or things.
column15: The hotel pool is always overcrowded .
column52: Curso::1C1::April Curso::1C1::File_8 Curso::1C1::Vocabulary-Bank::Travel-and-Tourism English English::2VOC Portugues::1VOC Voc::Travel Voc::Travel::English

column8: Não tão bom quanto as pessoas dizem.
column14: Not as good as people say it is.
column15: I think that restaurant is overrated . It’s not as good as people say.
column52: Curso::1C1::April Curso::1C1::File_8 Curso::1C1::Vocabulary-Bank::Travel-and-Tourism English English::2VOC Portugues::1VOC Voc::Travel Voc::Travel::English

column8: Atrativo de uma forma antiga ou encantadora.
column14: Attractive in an old-fashioned or charming way.
column15: We went to a very picturesque little fishing village yesterday.
column52: Curso::1C1::April Curso::1C1::File_8 Curso::1C1::Vocabulary-Bank::Travel-and-Tourism English English::2VOC Portugues::1VOC Voc::Travel Voc::Travel::English

column8: Caro ou a custar mais do que o esperado.
column14: Expensive or costing more than expected.
column15: The hotel breakfast was a bit pricey , but it was worth it.
column52: Curso::1C1::April Curso::1C1::File_8 Curso::1C1::Vocabulary-Bank::Travel-and-Tourism English English::2VOC Portugues::1VOC Voc::Travel Voc::Travel::English

column8: Em mau estado devido a negligência ou idade.
column14: In poor condition due to neglect or age.
column15: The main square is quite smart, but the buildings behind are very run-down .
column52: Curso::1C1::April Curso::1C1::File_8 Curso::1C1::Vocabulary-Bank::Travel-and-Tourism English English::2VOC Portugues::1VOC Voc::Travel Voc::Travel::English

column8: Que carece de caráter ou calor humano; pouco acolhedor.
column14: Lacking character or warmth; uninviting.
column15: The modern part of the city is mainly soulless office blocks.
column52: Curso::1C1::April Curso::1C1::File_8 Curso::1C1::Vocabulary-Bank::Travel-and-Tourism English English::2VOC Portugues::1VOC Voc::Travel Voc::Travel::English

column8: Extremamente impressionante ou visualmente deslumbrante.
column14: Extremely impressive or visually stunning.
column15: We saw some spectacular scenery on the road trip.
column52: Curso::1C1::April Curso::1C1::File_8 Curso::1C1::Vocabulary-Bank::Travel-and-Tourism English English::2VOC Portugues::1VOC Voc::Travel Voc::Travel::English

column8: Danificado ou tornado menos agradável.
column14: Damaged or made less enjoyable.
column15: The seafront has been spoilt by all the new hotels.
column52: Curso::1C1::April Curso::1C1::File_8 Curso::1C1::Vocabulary-Bank::Travel-and-Tourism English English::2VOC Portugues::1VOC Voc::Travel Voc::Travel::English

column8: De mau gosto ou de fabrico barato.
column14: Poor taste or cheaply made.
column15: The souvenirs were all plastic Eiffel Towers and keyrings – really tacky stuff.
column52: Curso::1C1::April Curso::1C1::File_8 Curso::1C1::Vocabulary-Bank::Travel-and-Tourism English English::2VOC Portugues::1VOC Voc::Travel Voc::Travel::English

column8: Que causa fadiga ou exaustão.
column14: Causing fatigue or exhaustion.
column15: What do you do to relax after a tiring day?
column52: Curso::1C1::April Curso::1C1::File_8 Curso::1C1::Vocabulary-Bank::Travel-and-Tourism English English::2VOC Portugues::1VOC Voc::Travel Voc::Travel::English

column8: Projetado para ou cheio de turistas, muitas vezes de forma artificial.
column14: Designed for or filled with tourists, often in an artificial way.
column15: The shops are quite touristy , but we bought some nice things.
column52: Curso::1C1::April Curso::1C1::File_8 Curso::1C1::Vocabulary-Bank::Travel-and-Tourism English English::2VOC Portugues::1VOC Voc::Travel Voc::Travel::English

column8: Que não chama a atenção ou não parece impressionante.
column14: Not attracting attention or appearing impressive.
column15: The hotel entrance is unimposing , but the lobby inside is impressive.
column52: Curso::1C1::April Curso::1C1::File_8 Curso::1C1::Vocabulary-Bank::Travel-and-Tourism English English::2VOC Portugues::1VOC Voc::Travel Voc::Travel::English

column8: Não alterado ou danificado pelo turismo ou pelo desenvolvimento moderno.
column14: Not changed or damaged by tourism or modern development.
column15: It’s a lovely city, almost completely unspoilt by tourism.
column52: Curso::1C1::April Curso::1C1::File_8 Curso::1C1::Vocabulary-Bank::Travel-and-Tourism English English::2VOC Portugues::1VOC Voc::Travel Voc::Travel::English

column8: Ir às compras, especialmente quando novos produtos são lançados.
column14: To go shopping, especially when new products are released.
column15: My new book hits the shops tomorrow. I’m so nervous.
column52: Curso::1C1::April Curso::1C1::File_8 Curso::1C1::Vocabulary-Bank::Travel-and-Tourism English English::2VOC Portugues::1VOC Voc::Travel Voc::Travel::English

column8: Num lugar remoto ou menos conhecido.
column14: In a remote or less-known place.
column15: We found a tiny café in the backstreets of Venice, right off the beaten track .
column52: Curso::1C1::April Curso::1C1::File_8 Curso::1C1::Vocabulary-Bank::Travel-and-Tourism English English::2VOC Portugues::1VOC Voc::Travel Voc::Travel::English

column8: Experimentar a comida tradicional de uma região ou país.
column14: To try traditional food from a region or country.
column15: When I’m visiting a foreign country, I love to sample the local cuisine .
column52: Curso::1C1::April Curso::1C1::File_8 Curso::1C1::Vocabulary-Bank::Travel-and-Tourism English English::2VOC Portugues::1VOC Voc::Travel Voc::Travel::English

column8: O clima ou sensação num determinado lugar ou situação.
column14: The mood or feeling in a particular place or situation.
column15: There was a lovely atmosphere at the local market.
column52: Curso::1C1::April Curso::1C1::File_8 Curso::1C1::Vocabulary-Bank::Travel-and-Tourism English English::2VOC Portugues::1VOC Voc::Travel Voc::Travel::English

column8: Estilo ou método de culinária, especialmente característico de um país ou região.
column14: A style or method of cooking, especially characteristic of a particular country or region.
column15: I love Italian cuisine , especially the fresh pasta dishes.
column52: Curso::1C1::April Curso::1C1::File_8 Curso::1C1::Vocabulary-Bank::Travel-and-Tourism English English::2VOC Portugues::1VOC Voc::Travel Voc::Travel::English

column8: Uma caminhada lenta e relaxada.
column14: A slow and relaxed walk.
column15: I’ve been working at home all day. I’m going for a stroll to get a breath of fresh air.
column52: Curso::1C1::April Curso::1C1::File_8 Curso::1C1::Vocabulary-Bank::Travel-and-Tourism English English::2VOC Portugues::1VOC Voc::Travel Voc::Travel::English

column8: Descontrair e deixar de sentir-se stressado ou ansioso.
column14: To relax and stop feeling stressed or anxious.
column15: You’ve been working too much. You need to chill out now.
column52: Curso::1C1::April Curso::1C1::File_8 Curso::1C1::Vocabulary-Bank::Travel-and-Tourism English English::2VOC Portugues::1VOC Voc::Travel Voc::Travel::English

column8: Prolongar a duração ou aumentar o tamanho de algo.
column14: To make something longer in duration or size.
column15: There were so many things to visit that we decided to extend our trip.
column52: Curso::1C1::April Curso::1C1::File_8 Curso::1C1::Vocabulary-Bank::Travel-and-Tourism English English::2VOC Portugues::1VOC Voc::Travel Voc::Travel::English

column8: Viajar com uma mochila, geralmente com um orçamento limitado.
column14: To travel with a backpack, often on a budget.
column15: They went backpacking in Argentina last year.
column52: Curso::1C1::April Curso::1C1::File_8 Curso::1C1::Vocabulary-Bank::Travel-and-Tourism English English::2VOC Portugues::1VOC Voc::Travel Voc::Travel::English

column8: Ficar ao ar livre numa tenda ou caravana para recreação.
column14: To stay outdoors in a tent or caravan for recreation.
column15: Have you decided to go camping this year?
column52: Curso::1C1::April Curso::1C1::File_8 Curso::1C1::Vocabulary-Bank::Travel-and-Tourism English English::2VOC Portugues::1VOC Voc::Travel Voc::Travel::English

column8: Viajar ou tirar um tempo livre para relaxar.
column14: To travel or take time off for relaxation.
column15: When are you going to go on holiday ? Is it next week?
column52: Curso::1C1::April Curso::1C1::File_8 Curso::1C1::Vocabulary-Bank::Travel-and-Tourism English English::2VOC Portugues::1VOC Voc::Travel Voc::Travel::English

column8: Atrasar um evento ou ação para um momento posterior.
column14: To delay an event or action to a later time.
column15: My mum wasn’t feeling well so we decided to postpone the trip.
column52: Curso::1C1::April Curso::1C1::File_8 Curso::1C1::Vocabulary-Bank::Travel-and-Tourism English English::2VOC Portugues::1VOC Voc::Travel Voc::Travel::English

column8: Atrasar algo ou mudar um evento para um momento posterior.
column14: To delay doing something or move an event to a later time.
column15: We had to put off our trip to India because of extreme weather conditions.
column52: Curso::1C1::April Curso::1C1::File_8 Curso::1C1::Vocabulary-Bank::Travel-and-Tourism English English::2VOC Portugues::1VOC Voc::Travel Voc::Travel::English

column8: Mudar a hora ou a data de um evento.
column14: To change the time or date of an event.
column15: We’ll have to reschedule the meeting.
column52: Curso::1C1::April Curso::1C1::File_8 Curso::1C1::Vocabulary-Bank::Travel-and-Tourism English English::2VOC Portugues::1VOC Voc::Travel Voc::Travel::English

column8: Iniciar uma viagem.
column14: To begin a journey.
column15: I can’t see you tomorrow. I’m setting off on a journey.
column52: Curso::1C1::April Curso::1C1::File_8 Curso::1C1::Vocabulary-Bank::Travel-and-Tourism English English::2VOC Portugues::1VOC Voc::Travel Voc::Travel::English

column8: Aproveitar e desfrutar de uma experiência ou ambiente.
column14: To absorb and enjoy an experience or atmosphere.
column15: It was such a beautiful scene that we sat down to soak up the atmosphere.
column52: Curso::1C1::April Curso::1C1::File_8 Curso::1C1::Vocabulary-Bank::Travel-and-Tourism English English::2VOC Portugues::1VOC Voc::Travel Voc::Travel::English

column8: Relaxar e reduzir o stress.
column14: To relax and reduce stress.
column15: You need to unwind a bit. Why don’t you go for a walk?
column52: Curso::1C1::April Curso::1C1::File_8 Curso::1C1::Vocabulary-Bank::Travel-and-Tourism English English::2VOC Portugues::1VOC Voc::Travel Voc::Travel::English

column8: Caminhar sem direção ou propósito definido.
column14: To walk around a place with no clear direction or purpose.
column15: We wandered round the old town for hours.
column52: Curso::1C1::April Curso::1C1::File_8 Curso::1C1::Vocabulary-Bank::Travel-and-Tourism English English::2VOC Portugues::1VOC Voc::Travel Voc::Travel::English

column8: Fazer uma pausa do stress e das responsabilidades do dia a dia.
column14: To take a break from daily stress and responsibilities.
column15: It’s been a crazy time at the office. I need to book a holiday and get away from it all .
column52: Curso::1C1::April Curso::1C1::File_8 Curso::1C1::Vocabulary-Bank::Travel-and-Tourism English English::2VOC English::Idioms Portugues::1VOC Voc::Travel Voc::Travel::English

column8: Descansar e recuperar energia.
column14: To rest and regain energy.
column15: A week’s holiday is all I need to recharge my batteries.
column52: Curso::1C1::April Curso::1C1::File_8 Curso::1C1::Vocabulary-Bank::Travel-and-Tourism English English::2VOC English::Idioms Portugues::1VOC Voc::Travel Voc::Travel::English
